meanings.definition: A punctuation mark (-) used to join words or parts of words together.
meanings.sent1: I used a hyphen to connect the two words.
meanings.sent2: The compound word is written with a hyphen in between.
meanings.sent3: The hyphen danced between the words, bringing them closer together.
meanings.sent4: The hyphen acted as a bridge, linking the two parts seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The hyphen hugged the words tightly, never letting them drift apart.

meanings.definition: To connect or separate with a hyphen.
meanings.sent1: She will hyphenate the compound word for clarity.
meanings.sent2: Remember to hyphenate the last names when filling out the form.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally hyphenated the wrong words, creating a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Hyphenating the phrases added a sense of rhythm to the text.
meanings.sent5: The author carefully hyphenated the words, creating a harmonious flow.
